abstracts.cdata!:
This is the Implementation Completion
            Report (ICR) for the Private Power Utilities Project for the
            Bombay Suburban Electric Supply Ltd. (BSES) in India. The
            principal objectives of the Project were to: (a) provide
            additional generation, transmission and distribution
            capacity to meet the increasing demand for electricity in
            the Mumbai area; and (b) maintain the high quality of
            service to BSES consumers. The performance of International
            Bank for Reconstruction and Development (IBRD) in respect of
            project identification, preparation, appraisal and
            subsequent project implementation was satisfactory. The
            Borrower's performance was satisfactory throughout the
            project from preparation to implementation and operation.
            Major findings of the project are summarized as follows: (i)
            a private company is better suited to making strategic
            decisions which might be considered risky by public
            concerns; (ii) an utility should begin public consultations
            and dissemination of detailed information in respect of
            social and environmental impacts of any project at a very
            early stage of preparation; (iii) employment of competent
            consultants would help an utility to complete its project on
            time; (iv) use of higher quality of coal should be
            encouraged; and (v) it is important to set up a high-powered
            coordination committee to ensure that each institution plays
            its part as demanded by the schedule.
